availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Hayden (Frankfort, Kentucky, clerk and soldier)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Native of England. Married to Mary E. Hayden. Commissioned as a notary public in Kentucky in 1863. Notary public for Franklin County, Kentucky in 1864. Mustering officer, with the rank of first lieutenant, in the Office of the Adjutant General of Kentucky in 1864 and 1865. Clerk and acting assistant adjutant general in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), VII.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 99.
